runs.comm: back of a length, tucked off his hips softly towards square leg
hint of away swing, but Dilshan doesn't pay any mind to it. Plays the angle into him and flicks the fuller ball to deep midwicket

picked away and there's the first four of the night. Straying too straight in his efforts to tuck him up, but Kusal's just as effective with the flick. Beats short fine leg on his right and scurries away
shortish and just a shade outside off, Kusal stands up tall and blocks

oho! This is a brillliant strike, but Neesham on the deep midwicket boundary should have done a bit better. Full delivery on the pads and some handy wristwork has carried this all the way. Neesham was worried about treading on the rope, but he had some leeway behind him. Leaps as high as he could but the ball evades him
fullish and pushed across him, goes for a slog and misses completely
whipped off his hips to long leg as Boult starts off with a back-of-a-length indipper
slaps it in front of point as Boult goes short and wide. Set himself up on the back foot and thumped it
seeks third man as Boult fires in the yorker outside off. The angled bat fosters an inside edge which misses the stumps on its way to short fine leg
there's not much dew out there, but Boult's lost control of this one. Beamer over middle stump, Dilshan ducks under it and the umpire issues a warning
too straight and he clips this length ball to deep square leg

strangled down the leg side! Boult comes back big time! Kusal goes for a flick, a shot he's already used to great advantage in this innings. Only he had planted his front leg a little too far across and his balance wasn't the best. Walks back shaking his head. Might have a reason to feel aggrieved there, think it might have been off the pad...
full and swinging in at him, Mahela's flick doesn't count for the movement and he's struck on the pads. Pitched outside leg stump though
he had premeditated that and Mills attempts to outsmart him with a slower ball. Instead he has to watch it being dil-scooped from outside off stump to the boundary behind the keeper
shortish ball with a bit of room outside off, goes for a slash and misses
plants his front foot down the pitch and went for a flay over cover. This was a cross-seamer and grips on the pitch to duck back in at him. Misses the off stump by inches
rapid single as he leans forward and pushes to mid-on.
hint of room on offer and Mahela chops it off the back foot to point. Sublime timing makes it pop out of the fielder's hands even though it was hit right at him
change of pace again as this is full and on leg stump. Dilshan waited, but not long enough to time the pick-up shot off his pads
140kph, full and curls in on leg stump. Another flick shot doesn't hit the middle. Actually it doesn't even hit the bat
lovely line for the shape he's getting. Kept it on fifth stump and the length was fullish as well. Mahela is forward and blocks into the leg side for a single

one dil-scoop too many! Well, this was the reverse one. Boult keeps it back of a length on middle. Dilshan backed away and tried to get under it, but it was just too quick and for that stroke. Only manages to lob it to a back-pedalling Ronchi
appreciable away swing! This was just back of a good length and outside off stump. Wanted him to fish for it, but Sanga doesn't
persists with the corridor outside off and Sanga doesn't want to play
142kph, mild shout from New Zealand as they succeed in making Sanga poke outside his off stump. The shortish ball hasn't nicked the bat though
132kph, this ball is nipping around early. Good length ball curls in at him and Mahela was cramped up as he defends
pushes it across the right-hander, who dabs goes back and it to point
restrains his stroke just that little bit longer to guide that back of a length delivery down to third man
slower delivery on off stump, Sanga is forward and blocks
fuller and just a shade outside off, taps it to cover point
walks across to off stump and defends this fuller delivery back to the bowler
keeps it tight on middle, but Mahela nudges it softly in the region of midwicket for a single
a bit too full despite the hint of away swing. Sanga is forward and drills one of his famous cover drives all along the ground
persists with a fuller length and Sanga respects it with a defence
140kph, races down the track but Boult changes his length and digs it in. The batsman tries to slash it over the top on the off side but misses wildly
fullish delivery on off stump, he defends into the covers but New Zealand's fielders are quite agile

holes out at mid-off! Hit his bat too high and it turned in his hand as he tried to drag a short ball from outside off. It's Boult's third over and New Zealand are rewarded for persisting with the quick. Sanga was getting twitchy for being kept so quiet and went after one that wasn't quite there
starts with a fullish delivery on the pads which is whipped away to long-leg
138kph, absolutely gorgeous! Drew him into a push outside off stump but the away swing on offer beats the outside edge
thick edge, but though N Mac dives full length to his left and gets a bit on it. But it was always going away from him. Such a tough chance
full and swinging in on middle, he drives down the ground

there is definitely some extra bounce being derived from this pitch by these burly NZ quicks. This was shortish on and around off stump and Mahela has to yank his bottom hand off the bat while defending
searing yorker on middle at 142kph. Thirimanne does excellently well just keeping it out.
140kph, ducks back in off a good length. Mahela plants his front leg on middle and off and somehow defends around it
139kph, back of a length on off stump, Mahela absorbs the pace and plays with soft hands towards square leg
targets middle with one that was just back of a good length, he has to hurry into a defensive push.
140kph, that's cheeky! But he's seen there's enough pace to work with and ramps the short ball outside off over the slips and to the third man boundary
141kph, full on off stump, Thirimanne drives solidly into the covers
loses his line just a touch as this good length ball slides down leg
140kph, finishes his spell with a good length ball that ducks back in at him. Thirimanne gets an inside edge onto his pads
133 kph, Mahela lunges forward and looks to drive this wide, full delivery through the covers. Beaten
fullish and a lot closer to off stump, pushed towards short cover
nudged away uppishly through the vacant midwicket to raise the Sri Lankan fifty. Strayed a little too close to the pads there
dug in short and just outside off, Mahela wanted to pull it first, then decided to ramp it midway through and because of his indecision, he can't put bat to ball
terrific delivery! He has slowed this down and it grips the pitch and cuts away. Mahela was poking outside off and is comfortably beaten
cut him in half! Anderson flings down the indipper around the fourth stump. Mahela was not expecting the movement and tries to block it. Too late on the shot and could have dragged it on too!
shortish and just outside off, Thirimanne is lured into a dab square on the off side. The away movement defeats him
142kph, tucks him up on middle, but Thirimanne wants that as he picks it away through square leg
142kph, fullish on middle and leg, whipped away to deep midwicket
walks across to off stump and McClenaghan adjusts his line and length. Shortish and pushed further outside off. Thirimanne can only defend
133kph, lovely timing, but it's only one to the sweeper on the deep. This was shortish and outside off again and Thirimanne chops it away
136kph, another neat little stroke to end the over. Too full and Mahela shuffles across to whip it to deep midwicket

134kph, mid-on was back-pedaling and though he pulls out a last-minute leap, the loft beats him. Might just have grazed his fingertips. This was fullish on off stump and Thirimanne picked it up and just got enough elevation
fullish and angled in at him, clipped off his pads behind square to the man in the deep
105 kph, slower ball gone wrong as this is pushed full and well wide outside off
shortish delivery outside off stump, Mahela had cleared his front leg, perhaps a little too much as he fails to time the cut shot
121kph, pulls a little bit of pace off this length ball on middle. Mahela tucks it away behind square leg
opens the face and guides this short of a length ball down to third man
115kph, no timing whatsoever as he goes for an almighty slog. Anderson's duped him with a slower ball on middle. Inside edge wanders down to deep square leg

short and wide outside off but it ends up a wicket-taking delivery! Thirimanne has slapped it down the throat of deep third man! Possibly the worst ball of the match so far, but the pressure that's been put on Sri Lanka fetches the wicket. Think this went right off the bottom of the blade as he unleashed a cut to with the intent of clearing the ropes
full and curling down leg, Mahela glances it past the diving keeper and cashes in with an easy boundary
dabs it past the slip fielder as this was back of a length and outside off
fired in full on leg stump, clipped to the right of deep square leg. Mathews is fresh at the crease and he's collected two
ventures down the track and tries to crunch this back of a length ball past the bowler. Neesham doesn't let him with a little bit of movement away
bit of width on offer and Mathews cuts down and to the right of backward point. The fielder though is good enough to get a hand to it
keeps it full and flat and it goes on with the arm. Mathews was looking for the turn and edges to short third man
closes his bat too early again and this fuller ball takes the leading edge into the covers
Mahela is more away of his tactics as he plays him for the straighter one and dabs into the coveres
good length ball nudged into midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, Mathews drives to long-on
sees this on a length and on leg stump and goes for the reverse sweep. Just not enough room to strike it well enough.
back of a length on and around off stump, defended to the right of the bowler
back of a good length and pushed across outside off, tapped into the covers
change of pace as this is fullish on off stump. Mathews was a little early and was left playing away from the body. Manages to push it down the ground to long-on
138kph, dug in short and pushed outside off. Mahela happily lets it go and collects the wide as it sailed over his head
walks at him and McClenaghan answers with a back-of-a-length inducker. Negotiates it well enough as he guides this to deep point

nicks off and McClenaghan has his first of the night! Simple length ball pushed across him and Mathews chased after it. The on-the-up drive ends up resulting in an outside edge and Ronchi pouches a regulation catch
greets him with a yorker that's angled on middle and leg. Thisara digs it out to mid-on
swept, but only as far as short fine leg. Mahela hasn't found his timing in this innings at all
another paddle as this is tossed up a little more outisde off. Can't beat short fine again
this is pushed through full on leg stump. Mahela attempts a fine sweep but can't connect
flighted outside off and he drags it off the front foot to midwicket
betters the previous shot by dancing down the track to reach the pitch and he lofts it over the head of midwicket. If he can't get it through, he'll get it over
that's his fourth sweep shot in this over. None of them have been timed and this one is so bad that he misses it and sees his leg stump knocked back!
low full toss on off stump, Thisara belts it down the ground. The bowler sticks his hands out to his right but he was nowhere near
this was in the slot but Thisara's slash isn't off the middle. Finds deep point after a couple of bounces
bunted to mid-on as this was on a length and outside off. McCullum was teased into striking the stumps at the bowlers' because the batsman hadn't grounded his bat

guided straight into the hands of short cover! Sri Lanka are being picked apart with the passing of each over. Back of a good length delivery pushed across him and Kula stays beside it and has smacked his first ball of the match straight to N Mac
back of a length and outside off, Senanayake dabs it just wide of the slip fielder
chopped down to third man and Sena will keep the strike
races down the track and goes for a heave, gets it off the inside edge to long leg. Think that was a slower ball again
130kph, back of a length and sliding across him. Thisara is lured into chasing it and he is soundly beaten
takes off from the pitch as he bends his back. Shortish ball sails past his outside edge
clears his front leg to cart this length ball outside off stump straight down the ground. No luck

terrific effort from Guptill! The captain appreciates it despite the ball going for four. Thisara finally connects with a slash. He had placed it to the left of deep cover who had to run in as well. Throws himself forward and gets a fingertip to it.
just short of a good length on middle, Thisara nearly swings off his feet as the ball misses the middle bail by inches
fullish and outside off, drilled to the left of mid-off
slower ball, pushed wide of off stump. Thisara cleared his front leg to lash it over extra. Gave himself too much room
lenght ball tucking him up on middle and leg, Thisara belts it down the ground to long-on
much-needed strike from Sena! This was length again from Neesham and he's been tonked over mid-off.
races down the track and though it was dug in short, Neesham doesn't have the pace to keep the batsman quiet. Sena's slapped it to the sweeper and Guptill is up for it

long-on parries it over the ropes for six. Anderson's running off to the dug out, clutching the right hand. Think he's done something to it. Length ball again and Sena got under it nicely and swung straight down the ground
streaky boundary but they'll take it. Short of a length on middle, Thisara wants it over midwicket but accepts it over short third man

this is a skier, Williamson settles under it and takes it! Change of pace foils Thisara's big-hitting intent. Cutter from Mills kept on a full length outside off. He made room for himself to blast it over the covers. Only succeeded in getting a thick outside edge
shortish on off stump, dabbed to short third man and he calls Herath through for a suicidal single! Direct hit would have caught him yards out
keeps him to a defensive push to mid-off. Absolutely no room given

there was a run-out at either end and they've fluffed it! Short and wide and he's slapped it straight it point. Sena and Herath were confused whether they should go for it or not and were almost ready to shake hands in the middle of the pitch, The throw comes to Mills who runs back and underarms it at the stumps and misses
fuller and just outside off, steered between short third man and point
he's actually embarrassed by picking up that wicket. It was a juicy full toss with ample width outside off and Sena's slapped it into the hands of a diving Williamson
golden duck for Malinga on captaincy debut! Fuller delivery fired in down leg as he had seen Malinga making room for himself. Ricochets off the pads and clatters into the stumps
